intro: Nierembergia pulchella var. longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled nierembergia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are ovate with a slightly hairy texture, and the flowers are often borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variant is distinguished by its elongated stamens, which give it its specific epithet "longistyla."
